page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: Shareshill,Saredon and Calf Heath is a predominantly farming area with eleven farms and several smallholdings.All the farms are family owned,some having been in the family for several generations. Five of the farms are classed as stock farms,breeding beef cattle and sheep for the cattle markets.There is no longer any dairy farming in the area, due mainly to stringent hygiene controls and regulations imposed by the government and the E.E.C. Wheat and barley are the main crops grown but oil seed rape is becoming popular due to cash subsidies given by the E.E.C. Silage is cultivated on the stock farms to provide winter feed for the animals who are housed in large barns in adjoining fields.Treated sewage is used to improve the yield.
